intro: Corpuscularia gracillima, commonly known as the slender corpuscularia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, erect stems and small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
